sentences.english: Thus, it is not surprising that Hong Kong finally lays claim to Prof Cui's achievement.
sentences.chinese: 因此，香港最终能够造就出一个崔教授，并不稀奇。

sentences.english: It’s funny how people’s obsessions come back to bite them.
sentences.chinese: 稀奇的是，执着的人们如何反咬一口。

sentences.english: But until the age of the Internet, anonymity was a rare thing.
sentences.chinese: 但是到了互联网时代，匿名性是个稀奇的事情。

sentences.english: It's not surprising that these folks weighed more and had larger waists.
sentences.chinese: 这并不稀奇，那些人为什么会超重而且十分胖。

sentences.english: Who will tell the children those 3)outlandish stories?
sentences.chinese: 谁将把这些稀奇古怪的故事告诉我们的后辈呢？

sentences.english: The oddity is that almost everywhere the European left is in decline.
sentences.chinese: 稀奇的是，几乎欧洲每个角落的左派势力都在衰退。

sentences.english: The use of animals in eccentric acts appears to have increased.
sentences.chinese: 稀奇古怪的动物选手似乎越来越多。

sentences.english: Curiously, this is across both 3G and Wifi networks.
sentences.chinese: 稀奇古怪地，在3G和Wifi网络都是这样。

sentences.english: He collected a quantity of curious information.
sentences.chinese: 他搜集了大量稀奇古怪的消息。

sentences.english: Cracked and husky voices pronounced forcibly upon odd matters.
sentences.chinese: 粗哑的声音在使劲地讲述着稀奇古怪的事情。

sentences.english: In a sense, this is nothing new.
sentences.chinese: 在某种意义上，这并不稀奇。

sentences.english: Gone are the big round eyes and the strange hair colours.
sentences.chinese: 大大的圆眼睛和稀奇古怪的发色已经不流行了。

sentences.english: This apparent defeat resulted in a miraculous victory.
sentences.chinese: 显著的失败结果，反是稀奇的胜利。

sentences.english: This is an odd collection of people.
sentences.chinese: 这是一群稀奇古怪的人。

sentences.english: During the fever he became delirious and said some strange things.
sentences.chinese: 发高烧时他神志昏迷，说了些稀奇古怪的事。

sentences.english: Two men sitting under a tree, wandering thoughts about their own home.
sentences.chinese: 两个人坐在一棵大树下，说起自己家乡的稀奇事。

definition: rare/uncommon/rarity/to value as a rarity/to cherish/Taiwan pr. [xi1 han3]
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to seem/to appear/(in a negative or interrogative sentence) to be sure
rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
erhua variant of 玩意[wan2 yi4]
toy/plaything/thing/act/trick (in a performance, stage show, acrobatics etc)
